channel.title: Mapping
channel.description: Discuss mapping positions, projects, and other related topics here.

item.title: Custom Sound questions
item.author: invalid@example.com (Editor_n00b)
item.dc:creator: Editor_n00b
item.content:encoded:
I don't know where else to post this, so I'll just post it here.

I need help with some custom audio I'm recording. Just a few questions.

Question 1: When initially recording a sound, can I just use the Sound Recorder program? Do i need a specific recording program to be compatible with UT2k4?

Question 2: How do I import sounds into Unreal? I know it needs to be a .umx file (or something like that) and then I need to compile it (or something like that), but can I just change the...

Custom Sound questions

item.title: Devastation: Mission Sequence Listing
item.author: invalid@example.com (MrBond)
item.dc:creator: MrBond
item.content:encoded:
This is the mission listing thus far for Devastation (as well as the mapper that has volunteered). All map names, descriptions, and sequences are still debatable. Items marked with "???" are unknown.

Assignment #00 A
- Locale: Delcove, Egypt; Civilian District
- Concentration: Hotel ???, Starport ???
- Mapper: Reciprocity

Assignment #00 B
- Locale: Delcove, Egypt; Industrial District
- Concentration: EMTO Headquarters
- Mapper: Destructive-Fly

Assignment #01
-...

Devastation: Mission Sequence Listing

item.title: Devastation: Mapping
item.author: invalid@example.com (MrBond)
item.dc:creator: MrBond
item.content:encoded:
Here's the current list of people working on Devastation (as far as mapping), and what I know about what they're working on.

McTerry
Map: Skaarj Prison

Rakiayn
Map: Skaarj Base Entry

Substruction (a.k.a. Destructive-Fly)
Map: Intro Map Section #2 (see below)

Reciprocity
Map: Intro Map Section #1 (see below)

Revenga
Map: None

And FYI: just because you're listed here and not elsewhere doesn't mean I'm not acknowledging your assistance in other areas.

item.title: While working
item.author: invalid@example.com (Destructive-Fly)
item.dc:creator: Destructive-Fly
item.content:encoded: Hey Bond, you said it might be a good idea to put some secret places and that sort of stuff. So when I was just working I thought it would be cool if we could make the keypads on the wall work and when peepz enter the right code the door would open. Now you see I'm not a coder so I would need help with this.

item.title: Mapping Tips
item.author: invalid@example.com (MrBond)
item.dc:creator: MrBond
item.content:encoded:
Greetings, all!

From my mapping days (and some more recent stuff), I come bearing tips to mappers of all levels. I am by no means perfect (as much as I tell myself, anyways ), so if somebody has some new/better tips, by all means, post and share them

Tip #1: SAVE SAVE SAVE SAVE SAVE....ad nauseum
That cannot be stressed enough. UnrealEd (or, more commonly, the UnrealEd goblin) will crash at least twice while you're working, often for no apparent reason. Save stable copies of...

Mapping Tips

item.title: more ladder woes....and lighting suggestions
item.author: invalid@example.com (Madd_Cracker)
item.dc:creator: Madd_Cracker
item.content:encoded:
my first post woohoo! come to think of it, its actually not that exciting....
i got the ladder to work well enough but when i go down them the player gets stuck, also i kinda need lighting suggestions for the map Base, the larger rooms have no light sources and as an artist that bugs the crap out of me.
any ways its good that we finally have a way to talk with more efficience good job mr. bond!

item.title: Windows totally beeped me
item.author: invalid@example.com (Destructive-Fly)
item.dc:creator: Destructive-Fly
item.content:encoded:
Lost my WIP map because Windows XP thought giving BSOD's was funny
Now I have to start all over again

item.title: Using this Forum
item.author: invalid@example.com (MrBond)
item.dc:creator: MrBond
item.content:encoded:
Greetings, all! This forum section (Mapping) deals with anything relating to both mapping and Bond Designs.

No particular guidelines to follow, just keep it on topic and in line with common sense. Spammers, etc. will be....handled. You have been warned.
